problem: A car travels at 60 km/h for 2 hours. What distance does it cover?
What is the net force on a 5 kg object with acceleration 3 m/s^2?
An object falls freely from 20 m height. How long does it take to reach the ground? (g = 10 m/s^2)
What is the kinetic energy of a 4 kg object moving at 5 m/s?
A spring with constant k = 200 N/m is compressed 0.1 m. What is the elastic potential energy?
What is the weight of a 10 kg object on Earth? (g = 9.8 m/s^2)
A circuit has a resistance of 10 ohms and a voltage of 20 V. What is the current?
What is the power dissipated in a 5 ohm resistance with 3 A current?
An object is thrown upward with initial velocity 20 m/s. What is the maximum height? (g = 10 m/s^2)
Two charges of 2 C and 3 C are separated by 1 m. What is the force between them? (k = 9*10^9)
A simple pendulum has length 1 m. What is its period? (g = 10 m/s^2)
How much work does a 50 N force do when moving an object 4 m in the direction of the force?
An ideal gas occupies 2 L at 300 K. If heated to 600 K at constant pressure, what is the new volume?
What is the speed of a wave with frequency 50 Hz and wavelength 3 m?
A projectile is launched horizontally from 45 m height at 10 m/s. How far does it land? (g = 10 m/s^2)
A 2 kg object moves at 3 m/s. What is its linear momentum?
How much energy is needed to heat 500 g of water by 20 degrees? (c = 4.18 J/g C)
A 10 uF capacitor is charged to 12 V. How much energy does it store?
A lever has force arm 2 m and resistance arm 0.5 m. If 10 N force is applied, what resistance does it overcome?
An object floats in water with density 1000 kg/m^3. If its submerged volume is 0.002 m^3, what is its mass?
solution: Buoyancy = weight, rho*V*g = m*g, m = rho*V = 1000*0.002 = 2 kg
